title: fix(compiler): remove i18n markup even if no translations
body:
## PR Type
What kind of change does this PR introduce?

```
[x] Bugfix
```

## What is the current behavior?
We only remove i18n markup (i18n attributes / comments) when we load translations. This means that the build for the main source language (eg: english) will keep i18n markup, including meaning/descriptions, which is not something that we want in production.

Issue Number: #11042


## What is the new behavior?
i18n markup is always removed in angular templates

## Does this PR introduce a breaking change?
```
[x] Yes
```
If you were relying on the same attributes used by angular, without using angular i18n, then those won't be available anymore, which means that it will break your application.
For example if you wrote a directive that uses `[i18n]` as a selector, it won't work anymore, because even if you don't use angular i18n, we'll remove those attributes.

title: abstractControl.markAsPending does not emit events
body:
## I'm submitting a ... 

[ ] Regression (behavior that used to work and stopped working in a new release)
[x] Bug report 
[ ] Feature request
[ ] Documentation issue or request
[ ] Support request => Please do not submit support request here, instead see https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#question
## Current behavior `abstractControl.markAsPending()` does not emit events. ## Expected behavior `abstractControl.markAsPending()` should emit `'PENDING'`. ## Minimal reproduction of the problem with instructions For bug reports please provide the *STEPS TO REPRODUCE* and if possible a *MINIMAL DEMO* of the problem via http://plnkr.co/edit/BzGil9?p=preview ## Please tell us about your environment 

Angular version: 4.2.X

title: Router navigation with lazy loading modules.
body:
## Current behavior Hi, we have a few lazy-loading modules and router's configured like: ``` { path: 'parent', component: Parent, children: [ { path: child1, loadChildren: 'pathToModule1' } { path: child2, loadChildren: 'pathToModule1' } ] } - child1 { path: '', component: Child1 } - child2 { path: '', component: Child2 } ``` So, when i'm on the Child1 a wanna navigate to child 2 with `this.router.navigate(['../child2'], {relativeTo: this.activatedRoute})` And we get **parent/child1/child2** But in cause of empty section added with lazy loading module configuration i should use `this.router.navigate(['../../child2'], {relativeTo: this.activatedRoute})` Because in fact we have **parent/child1 + ''** ## Expected behavior We get **parent/child2** Is there any way to change this behaviour ? Becouse with many nested lazy loading modules we'll get a littlebit empty sections and we'll write ../../../../../../sibling to go sibling route. ## Minimal reproduction of the problem with instructions any application with lazy loading modules. Just try navigate to sibling route. ## What is the motivation / use case for changing the behavior? ## Please tell us about your environment 

Angular version: 4.1.3


Browser: any

title: application breaks when routing accessed from a browser notification
body:
## I'm submitting a ... 

[ ] Regression (behavior that used to work and stopped working in a new release)
[x] Bug report 
[ ] Feature request
[ ] Documentation issue or request
[ ] Support request => Please do not submit support request here, instead see https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#question
## Current behavior Application breaks when a URL is accessed with `router.navigateByUrl` by clicking browser notification. When the same URL is accessed in any other way everything works fine. ## Expected behavior Application shouldn't break when accessed from browser notification. ## Minimal reproduction of the problem with instructions The bug is reproduced in this repository: https://github.com/Neverminder/quickstart Steps to reproduce expected behavior: 1. Launch the application opening url `/home` 2. Click the "Go to test" button 3. Observe dropdown working on the page `/test` Steps to reproduce the bug: 1. Launch the application opening url `/home` 2. Click the browser notification that appears 3. Observe dropdown not working and previous component also appearing making the page broken, errors in the javascript console ## What is the motivation / use case for changing the behavior? The bug should be fixed, otherwise browser notifications are rendered useless with Angular. ## Please tell us about your environment 

Angular version: 4.2.5

title: Language Service: More forgiving support of union types in templates
input element with ngModel initialized as null, fires "input" event on focus and blur in IE
body:
## I'm submitting a ... 

[ ] Regression (behavior that used to work and stopped working in a new release)
[x] Bug report 
[ ] Feature request
[ ] Documentation issue or request
[ ] Support request => Please do not submit support request here, instead see https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#question
## Current behavior input element with ngModel initialized as null, fires "input" event on focus and blur for empty(null) value ## Expected behavior Tested it with plain input element with "input" eventListener in IE, it isn't firing "input" events for above scenario. So, I assume it isn't an IE bug. "input" event (and consecutive onChange/ngModelChange) should not be fired on focus and blur. ## Minimal reproduction of the problem with instructions https://plnkr.co/edit/q9TgF9btZKquDjJuKDVz?p=preview https://jsfiddle.net/xry2Ltbn/4/ is an example with simple input element with input eventListener ## What is the motivation / use case for changing the behavior? ## Please tell us about your environment

title: perf(forms): aot generates significant amount of code for each control instance in template
body:
## I'm submitting a ... 

[ ] Regression (behavior that used to work and stopped working in a new release)
[ ] Bug report 
[x] Feature request
[ ] Documentation issue or request
[ ] Support request => Please do not submit support request here, instead see https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#question
## Current behavior Everything seems to be working as expected, but I wanted to point out a use case that I think is worth optimizing in the compiler or elsewhere. In one of our clients' applications, the AOT version is more than twice as large as the non-AOT version. The main culprit seems to be the code generated from form directives (particularly `DefaultValueAccessor`). For every instance of a form group or control in a template, about 1.3KB is added to the minified bundle. For an application with 20 forms and 15 controls in each form, this would mean an additional 390KB in the minified bundle. Gzip certainly improves things since the code is pretty repetitive, but the size is still significant, and gzip doesn't help JS parsing time. ## Expected behavior It would be nice if the code could be de-duplicated. ## Minimal reproduction of the problem with instructions 1. Check out this repository built with Angular CLI: [https://github.com/jeffbcross/repro-form-aot-bloat](https://github.com/jeffbcross/repro-form-aot-bloat) 1. `$ yarn` 1. Just build with ngc: `./node_modules/.bin/ngc -p src/tsconfig.json` 1. Look at `out-tsc/app/app/app.component.ngfactory.js` 1. Look at the generated code for `View_AppComponent_0` to see repetition 1. Build minified w/CLI: `ng build --prod` 1. Record size of `dist/main.bundle[hash].js` 1. Comment out control2 and control3 in `src/app/app.component.html` 1. Build minified w/CLI: `ng build --prod` 1. Compare size of `dist/main.bundle[hash].js` with bundle size when all controls are present Or just trust my numbers for main.bundle.js: State | Flag | Bytes | Bytes gzip ------|-----|-------|----------- Fresh checkout | --prod | 7883 | 1831 Comment out whole template, incl. form group | --prod | 2626 | 1074 Fresh checkout | --aot | 40111 | 5294 Comment out 1 control | --aot | 34931 | 5142 Comment out 2 controls | --aot | 29635 | 4805 Comment out all 3 controls | --aot | 24374 | 3997 Comment out whole template, incl. form group | --aot | 21209 | 3390 ## What is the motivation / use case for changing the behavior? Smaller, faster-parsing bundles for apps with many form controls. ## Please tell us about your environment 

Angular version: 4.2.5

title: aio: mobile - cache window history & restore on start
body:
**Problem:**

App doesn't remember where you were when you relaunch. 

This is especially annoying on iPhone when docviewer is a "home screen app" because, if you switch to another app and switch back, the app restarts on the home page, having forgotten what you were looking at. No real app does that.

Remembering where you were would be nice in any browser.

**Solutions:**

The docviewer can stash the window history to browser local storage (exists on iPhone whereas service worker does not). Can rebuild on launch with `history.pushState`

title: aio: configure dgeni to break build if there are dangling links
Prevent redeploys of aio using old versions of code
body:
## Current behavior
<!-- Describe how the issue manifests. -->
- if we merge two PRs quickly after each other and the first one takes longer to build, we could run into a situation where we deploy from the later CI job first and then deploy again from the first job that took extra long to finish.
- alternatively, a team member could go to an old CI build and restart it, causing a redeploy to happen using that commit.

In both situations the live site is redeployed with an older version of the application.

## Expected behavior
<!-- Describe what the desired behavior would be. -->

The live site is deployed with the latest app version and doesn't get redeployed with an older version unless we do a rollback via firebase console.

title: Http doesn't catch error
body:
## I'm submitting a ... 

[ ] Regression (behavior that used to work and stopped working in a new release)
[x] Bug report 
[ ] Feature request
[ ] Documentation issue or request
[ ] Support request => Please do not submit support request here, instead see https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#question
## Current behavior This is headless Chrome. ```ts const response = http.request('https://ipinfo.io/json'); response.subscribe( (response: Response) => { console.log(response.url); }, (e: any) => { console.error(e) }, () => { console.log('done'); } ); ``` ## Expected behavior Shows the URL in the console or an error. ## Minimal reproduction of the problem with instructions Right now, it is too complex. I only can show the output: ```text 2017/07/05 14:24:37.892] [WARN] [WORKER 001] [PID: 19236] [CORE] [SERVICE] [CHROME] stdeerr [0705/142437.891914:ERROR:cert_verify_proc_nss.cc(923)] CERT_PKIXVerifyCert for ipinfo.io failed err=-8179 ```` After 25 seconds: ```text [2017/07/05 14:31:30.459] [INFO] [WORKER 001] [PID: 28848] [CORE] [SERVICE] [CHROME] stateUrlList {"booted":true,"core":{"http":{"status":200,"counter":1,"counterUrlMap":{"https://ipinfo.io/json":1},"error":[]}},"app":{"web":{},"server":{}}} ``` It shows, that in 25 seconds ```https://ipinfo.io/json```, Angular is not giving any response. ## What is the motivation / use case for changing the behavior? This is headless environment. ## Please tell us about your environment 

Angular version: X.Y.Z

For Tooling issues:

title: Router: redirectTo only allows string params on absolute paths
body:
## I'm submitting a ... 

[ ] Regression (behavior that used to work and stopped working in a new release)
[ ] Bug report
[x ] Feature request
[ ] Documentation issue or request
[ ] Support request
## Current behavior There is no way to pass string query params on router redirectTo on relative paths. ## Expected behavior { path: '**', redirectTo: 'list?param=true', } ## Minimal reproduction of the problem with instructions It's a similar issue to the following one https://github.com/angular/angular/issues/9921, the fix was done but won't work for non-absolute paths. ## What is the motivation / use case for changing the behavior? When being redirected I would like to alert somehow that we come from a redirection so that we apply a different configuration to the components. ## Please tell us about your environment 

Angular version: 4.2.4
Browser: all

[x] No
```

<!-- If this PR contains a breaking change, please describe the impact and migration path for existing applications below. -->


## Other information

More general question, should we ban the `host: { 'xxx': 'literal' }` usage since it has no equivalent in `@HostBinding`/`@HostListener` way?

[ ] Documentation issue or request
[ ] Support request => Please do not submit support request here, instead see https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#question
## Current behavior When parsing the template at design-time, the Angular-cli compiler and/or Typescript throw nonsensical errors about `anonymous` and undefined data structure even when they are well defined and statically typed. ## Expected behavior If a property type is clearly supplied in the component, the template parser should recognize it. ## Minimal reproduction of the problem with instructions **component.ts** ``` /** * Info that drives the tabs in the template. Array is filled * in ngOnInit() once data is received from the server */ public tabs:Array<{ title:string, description:string, data:Array<{name:string}> }>=[]; ``` **component.html** ```
...
{{i.name}}
^^^^^^
``` **compiler error** > Angular: Identifier 'name' is not defined. `` does not contain such a member Here is [a plunk](http://plnkr.co/edit/CZWAT3DKUo37EPx4KkP5?p=preview) demonstrating the broken application. If you change the Typescript version from `2.3.4` (what I'm using) to `2.2.1` on line 44 of `config.js`, the application will run without problem. ## What is the motivation / use case for changing the behavior? Bug or sub-optimal error message ## Please tell us about your environment 

Angular version: 4.2.5
Typescript version: 2.3.4
angular/cli version: 1.20


Browser:
- [ ] Chrome (desktop) version XX
- [ ] Chrome (Android) version XX
- [ ] Chrome (iOS) version XX
- [ ] Firefox version XX
- [ ] Safari (desktop) version XX
- [ ] Safari (iOS) version XX
- [ ] IE version XX
- [ ] Edge version XX
 
For Tooling issues:
- Node version: 8.1.3 
- Platform: Windows 

Others:

This error was not raised witth `Angular 2` written in `Typescript 2.0.2`

title: fix(aio): home & marketing styles cleanup
body:
- Fixed spacing on announcement bar
- Fixed mobile view of announcement bar
- Added on-hover style on to-nag icon link image
- Remove l-relative class
- Removal of $unit constant
- Removed l-content class assignments to articles
- Centered ‘Getting Started’ button text
- Remove dupe promo-img-container and img code
- Moved feature styles to feature stylesheet
- List margin cleanup for legibility
